meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 4650 on the boundary of the People's Republic of Albania.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Mediterranean Continental Shelf, Delimitations and Regimes, Vol. 1, Book 1.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: The Decree establishes the maritime boundary of Albania.This Decree consists in amended articles 1 and 4 of Decree No. 4650 of 9 March 1970 regulating the boundary of the People's Republic of Albania. It extends the territorial waters of Albania to the width of 15 nautical miles or up to the Albania-Yugoslavia State boundary line (art. 1). Internal waters are the waters which lie within the straight baseline drawn to measure the territorial sea. It then delimits the territorial waters (art. 4).

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 84-181 définissant les lignes de base à partir desquelles est mesurée la largeur des zones maritimes sous juridiction nationale.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République algérienne, 7 août 1984, p. 813 à 815.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte comprend 4 articles. Il délimite la mer territoriale et les eaux intérieures de la République algérienne. La mer territoriale est mesurée à partir des lignes de base droites et des lignes de fermeture des baies (art. 1). L'article 3 définit les eaux intérieures comme étant les eaux situées en deçà des lignes de base définies à l'article 2. Ce dernier détermine les points géographiques choisis pour effectuer les mesures.

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 63-403 fixant l'étendue des eaux territoriales.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République algérienne nº 76, 15 octobre 1963.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Texte réglementaire fixant l'étendue des eaux territoriales. Ce texte comprend trois articles. L'article 1 stipule que la largeur des eaux territoriales algériennes est de douze milles marins. L'article 2 conditionne l'entrée des navires de guerre étrangers dans cette zone à l'accord préalable du Gouvernement. Il stipule aussi que la pêche est reservée aux ressortissants algériens, sauf autorisation accordée aux étrangers.

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 76-84 portant réglementation générale des pêches.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République algérienne, 13 avril 1977, p. 442 à 447.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Dans la première partie sur la réglementation générale, l'article 3 prévoit que l'exercice de la pêche maritime dans les eaux territoriales du pays est soumis à autorisation. La pêche peut être pratiquée dans trois zones distinctes: de pêche côtière, de pêche au large et de grande pêche (art. 2). En principe, la pêche maritime est interdite aux navires étrangers, sauf dérogation en vertu d'un accord international ou d'une autorisation ministérielle pour des opérations de pêche scientifique (art. 6). Le titre II (art. 9-20) détermine les conditions d'exercice de la pêche maritime. Ainsi, sont définis le pouvoir de réglementation du Ministre chargé des pêches (art. 10) et celui des autorités decentralisées (art. 11), les engins et substances prohibés (art. 15 et 12), les zones de pêche (art. 16), les espèces interdites à la pêche (art. 14 et 18). Le titre III (art. 21 à 28) traite des engins de pêche. Ces derniers sont classés en 5 catégories: a) filets, b )lignes et hamecons, c) pièges, d) engins de pêche par

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 79-236 portant création de l'entreprise nationale des pêches (E.NA.PECHES).

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République algérienne, 27 novembre 1979, p. 930 à 932.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte crée une entreprise socialiste nationale à caractère économique (E.NA-PECHES). Le décret nº 79-236 comprend 19 articles divisés en 6 titres. L'article 1 prévoit la création d'une entreprise socialiste nationale à caractère économique. Celle-ci est chargée notamment: de promouvoir et de développer les industries de production, d'exploitation, de distribution et de transformation des animaux et végétaux marins; de mettre en oeuvre l'organisation du marché des poissons et autres produits de la mer. Elle remplit, entre autres, les fonctions de commercialisation sur le marché intérieur et extérieur des produits de la mer, de developpement des activités piscicoles et aquacoles (art. 2). L'entreprise est dotée de la personnalité juridique et financière (art. 6). Elle est placée sous la tutelle et le contrôle du secretaire d'Etat à la pêche (art. 9). Les titres IV et V traitent du patrimoine et de la structure financière de l'entreprise, régis par les dispositions réglementaires relatives à l'entreprise soci

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 74-86 portant création de l'institut supérieur maritime.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République algérienne, 24 septembre 1974, p. 816 à 821.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: La présente ordonnance porte création de l'institut supérieur maritime, établissement public à caractère administratif, chargé d'assurer la formation des officiers de la navigation maritime, de commerce, de pêche et de servitude ainsi que celle des cadres administratifs de la marine marchande, des ports et des pêches (art. 4). L'ordonnance est composée de 43 articles organisés en 5 titres distincts. L'institut est placé sous la tutelle du Ministère chargé de la marine marchande (art. 1). Les programmes de l'Institut sont fixés par arrêté du ministre chargé de la marine marchande (art. 8). L'Institut est dirigé par un directeur (art. 11 à 17) et administré par un Conseil d'administration (art. 18 à 27). Il est doté d'un Conseil pédagogique (art. 28 à 32). La gestion et le budget de l'Institut sont organisés par les articles 33 à 39. La dissolution de l'Institut ne peut être prononcée que par un texte à caractère législatif (art. 41).

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act delimits the maritime areas of Antigua and Barbuda.This Act consists of 35 sections. Limits of internal and archipelagic waters, territorial sea, contiguous zone, continental shelf, exclusive economic zone and fishery zone and their methods of measurement are defined respectively in sections 3 to 11. The Act asserts the degree of jurisdiction of Antigua and Barbuda over the various maritime zones (sects. 12 to 15). The freedom of navigation is recognized in the exclusive economic zone (sect. 16). With regard to the freedom of navigation within the territorial sea a foreign ship shall be entitled to enjoy the right of innocent passage (sect. 18). Enforcement power enables authorized officers to stop, board, arrest and bring into port offending vessels and arrest the captain (sects. 22 and 30).

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Act to provide for the extension of the limits of the territorial waters of Antigua and Barbuda and Redonda, to make provisions for contiguous, exclusive economic and fishery zones and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.This Act comprises 24 sections. Provisions of sections 3 and 4 provide for the limits and methods of measurement of territorial waters. The areas of the sea which are on the landward side of the baselines of territorial waters are the internal waters (sect. 5). The seaward limits of the contiguous zone, the exclusive economic zone and the fishery zone are established respectively in sections 6, 7, and 8. In sections 9, 10, 11 and 12, the Act sets out the scope of Antigua and Barbuda's jurisdiction in territorial waters, exclusive economic zone and fishery zone. Negotiations shall be entered into in order to settle dispute related to the delimitation of maritime boundaries (sect. 13). A foreign vessel shall be entitled to enjoy the right of innocent passage in territorial

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to provide for the development and management of fisheries and matters incidental thereto.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: The Act is divided into 5 Parts: Preliminary provisions (Part 1); Fisheries management and development (Part 2); Marine reserves and conservation measures (Part 3); Enforcement (Part 4); General provisions (Part 5).Section 3 stipulates that the Minister shall promote the development of fisheries. An appointed Chief Fisheries Officer assisted by a Fishery Advisory Committee (sect. 5) shall prepare and keep under review a plan for the management and development of fisheries (sect. 4). Regional cooperation arrangements or agreements may be entered into with a view of harmonising licence procedures, collection of data, enforcement measures etc. (sect. 6-1). With regard to allocation of fishing rights to foreign fishing vessels, section 7 stipulates that the Minister, with the approval of the Cabinet, may enter into access agreements. The Act differentiates two kinds of fishing licences: a) a foreign fishing licence (sect. 8); b) a local fishing licence (sect. 11). It defines the requirements and conditions attach

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These Regulations are divided into 7 Parts i.e.: Preliminary (1); Fisheries Advisory Committee (2); Foreign Fishing Vessels (3); Local Fishing Licences (4); Fish Processing Establishment Licences (5); Fishery Conservation Measures (6); Miscellaneous Provisions (7); and 8 Schedules, i.e.: Application Form for a Foreign Fishing Licence (1); Foreign Fishing Licence (2); Application Form for a Local Fishing Vessel Licence (3); Local Fishing Licence (4); Fees for Local Fishing Vessel Licences (5); Application Form for Fish Processing Establishment Licence (6); Fish Processing Establishment Licence (7); Marking (8).The text establishes a Fisheries Advisory Committee (sec.3-1), determines its composition (sect. 3-2) and defines its functions (sect. 4). Under Part III, foreign fishing operations are subject to authorisation. No licence shall be issued to a foreign fishing vessel unless the applicant produces a certificate that the vessel is registered in the Regional Register (sect. 8). Section 9 sets out general con

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act relating to payments under certain fisheries agreements.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Sections 1 and 2 commence on the day on which this Act receives the Royal Assent.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Act relating to payments under certain fisheries agreements. The Act consists of 6 sections. This Act deals with both payments under fisheries agreements entered into with the government of another country and payments under fisheries agreements entered into otherwise than with the government of another country.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to make provision consequent upon, or associated with, the enactment of the Fisheries Administration Act 1991, the Fisheries Management Act 1991 and other related legislation, and for other purposes.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act makes provision for modifications in fisheries legislation after due to the enactment of the Fisheries Administration Act 1991 and the Fisheries Management Act 1991. This Act consists of 4 Parts divided into 22 sections: Preliminary (Part 1); Saving and transitional provisions (2); Amendment of the Primary Industries and Energy Research and Development Act 1989 (3); Amendments of other Acts (4).Part 2 of the present Act contains transitional and saving provisions in relation with repeal of the Fisheries Act 1952, other than Part IVa. Permits issued under section 6B of the Fisheries Act 1952 continue to be in force; licences issued under section 9 remain in force. Rules and Regulations issued under the Fisheries Act stay in force. The Northern Territory Fisheries Joint Authority and the Western Australia Fisheries Joint Authority established under section 12D of the Fisheries Act 1952 continue in existence as they had been established under Part 5 of the Fisheries Management Act 1991. Also any arrange

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to impose a charge on the grant of statutory fishing rights.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Subject to provisions of section 6, a charge is imposed on the grant of statutory fishing rights (sect. 5). A charge is not payable on a grant of a statutory fishing right declared by Regulations to be exempt of charge (sect. 6).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act relating to fisheries in certain waters between Australia and the Independent State of Papua New Guinea.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act provides rules relative to fisheries in the Torres Strait. The text consists of 7 Parts (60 sections), i.e. Preliminary (I); Administration (II); Regulation of Fishing (III); Licences, endorsements and entries (IV); Arrangements with Queensland (V); Enforcement (VI); Miscellaneous (VII).Part I gives, among other things, definitions such as Protected Zone, Community Fishing, Traditional Inhabitants, Traditional Fishing and Treaty Endorsement (sect. 3). Sections 4, 5 and 6 define the scope of application of the Act. These provisions differentiate between the Protected Zone, protected coastal waters of Queensland, and waters governed by an arrangement (Part V) or by a Proclamation (sect. 15-1). "In the administration of this Act, regard shall be had to the rights and obligations conferred on Australia by the Torres Strait Treaty and in particular to the traditional way of life and livelihood of traditional inhabitants, including their rights in relation to traditional fishing " (sect. 8). Part III, on r

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Maritime Legislation Amendment Act 1994 (Act No. 20 of 1994).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to amend the law relating to Australia's maritime zones under international law, and for related purposes.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Act comes into operation on a day to be fixed by Proclamation; If this Act does not commence under subsection (1) within the period of 6 months beginning on the day on which it receives the Royal Assent, it commences on the first day after the end of that period.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act contains 15 articles and two Annexes. Whereas the 15 articles amend the principal Act namely the Seas and Submerged Lands Act, 1973, Annex 1 includes the amendments of all the other related acts affected by these amendments to the principal Act. Parts II, V and VI of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea are set out in Annex 2. This text mainly translates into national legislation the contents of the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea done at Montego Bay on 10 December 1982.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation (in virtue of section 10B of the Seas and Submerged Lands Act 1973 and section 4 of the Interpretation Act 1901).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Proclamation creating an Australian Exclusive Economic Zone extending seaward up to 200 nautical miles in conformity with the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea 1982. A schedule fixes the lines constituting the outer limits of the EEZ.

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AFRICA DEL NORTE Y CERCANO ORIENTE

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 17 of 1981 on the registration of fishing vessel licences, the form for obtaining and renewing these licences and fees to be collected.

meta.name: entryIntoForce
meta.content: Entry into force on the date of publication in the Official Gazette.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Decree is composed of 8 articles and a form. the Registration Book known as "Register of Fishing Vessel Licences" shall be kept at the Fisheries Resources Department (art. 1). The owner of the vessel shall apply for vessel licence by the attached Form to the Fisheries Resources Department (art. 2). A charge of fifteen dinars shall be paid to the Fisheries Resources Department for obtaining the licence (art. 5). Trasgression and violation of this Decree shall be punished by Article 17 of Law No. 5 of 1981 on the regulation of fishing (art. 7).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Protection and Conservation of Fish Rules, 1985.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Regulations on protection and conservation of fish. The text contains 11 sections about various measures of protection and conservation and 2 Schedules specifying waters in which the catching of certain fish species is prohibitedwithouth a valid licence, specifying fish species of which the catching or sale in certain periods is prohibited, and containing a form of a licence for catching of carps in Prohibited Waters. Regulation 3 prohibits the erection of fixed engines in rivers and canals. No fish shall be destroyed by making use of poison or explosives (regs. 4 and 5). Licences issued under regulation 8 shall be issued only for purposes of pisciculture. Regulations prohibits the catching, carrying, transporting, offering for sale or possessing of frogs.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Protection and Conservation (Amendment) Ordinance 1982 (Ordinance No. LV).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Ordinance to further amend the Protection and Conservation of Fish Act, 1950.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: The amendments mainly concern definitions and technical matters. A new definition of fish is given: "fish" includes all cartilagenous, bony fish, prawn, shrimp, amphibians, tortoise, turtles, crustacean animals, molluscs, echinoderms and frogs at all stages in their life history. (11 sections)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi fixant la largeur de la mer territoriale de la Belgique.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: La largeur de la mer territoriale de la Belgique est portée à douze milles marins, soit vingt-deux mille deux cent vingt-quatre mètres, mesurée à partir de la laisse de basse mer de la côte, ou des hauts fonds découvrants à marée basse pour autant qu' ils se trouvent à moins de douze milles marins de cette laisse de basse mer, ou des extrémités des installations portuaires permanentes dépassant ladite laisse de basse mer, comme il est indiqué sur les cartes marines officielles belges à grande échelle (art. 1).Toute référence dans la législation ou réglementation belges à la mer territoriale de la Belgique s' entend dans le sens d' une mer territoriale dont la largeur est conforme à celle fixée par la présente loi (art. 2).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to make provision with respect to the Territorial Sea, Internal Waters and the Exclusive Economic Zone of Belize; and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: The text of the Act consists of 7 Parts, 25 sections and a Schedule. Preliminary (Part I); Maritime Areas of Belize (II); Rights in respect of Maritime Areas of Belize (III); Innocent Passage (Part IV); Charts and Geographical Co-ordinates (V); Jurisdiction of Courts and Other Legal Matters (VI); Miscellaneous (VII).The Maritime Areas of Belize comprise the territorial sea and the Exclusive Economic Zone. The territorial sea measures 12 nautical miles seawards from the baseline. Except as otherwise provided in subsections of section 4, the baseline from which the breadth of the territorial sea adjacent to Belize is measured shall be the low water line along the coast of the mainland of Belize as well as the coasts of all islands and cayes that form part of Belize. The EEZ extends 200 nautical miles seaward from the baseline (sect. 6) if not delimited for reasons of overlapping with an EEZ of an adjacent State (sect. 7). Part III outlines the rights of Belize in respect of the territorial sea, the subsoil of t

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 76-92 portant extension des eaux territoriales de la République Populaire du Benin à 200 miles nautiques.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Décret composé de 3 articles. L'article premier stipule que les eaux territoriales du Bénin sont portées à 200 miles nautiques. En principe, la pêche dans les eaux territoriales du Bénin est exclusivement réservée aux ressortissants béninois à l'excéption des pêcheurs étrangers ayant été expressement autorisés (article 2).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to provide for the more effectual regulation, control, protection and improvement of fish and fishing in Botswana.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act consists of 8 sections: Short title (sect. 1); Interpretation (sect. 2); Regulations (sect. 3); Prohibition of use of explosive, poisonous or noxious substances (sect. 4); Exemptions (sect. 5); Powers of entry, seizure and arrest (sect. 6); Obstructing officers (sect. 7); Disposal of articles after conviction (sect. 8).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº D 73-40 portant organisation de la pêche industrielle au Dahomey.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: L'exercice de la pêche industrielle est soumis à l'obtention préalable d'une licence de pêche (art.1). La durée, l'obtention et le renouvellement de la licence de pêche ainsi que le montant de la redevance selon le type de bateau de pêche consideré sont traités à l'art.2. Tout propriétaire physique ou moral doit respectivement avoir son siège ou résider (ou se faire représenter) sur le territoire de la République du Dahomey (art.4). Seuls les navires agés de moins de 7 ans peuvent pratiquer la pêche industrielle (art.5). La liste des agents habilités à rechercher et constater les infractions fait l'objet de l'art.8.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation establishing a Fisheries Zone contiguous to the Territorial Sea of Bermuda (G.N. 79/1972).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Proclamation establishes a fisheries zone of 12 nautical miles measured from the nearest point on the low-water line and contiguous to the territorial sea of Bermuda.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation extending the limits of the Fisheries Zone of Bermuda.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Proclamation extends the limits of the fisheries zone of Bermuda to 200 nautical miles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Bermuda (Territorial Sea) Order in Council 1988 (S.I. No. 1838 of 1988).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Order extends the outer limits of Bermuda so as to include, as territorial sea, the sea within twelve nautical miles of the baselines, together with its seabed and subsoil. It defines the baseline from which the breadth of the territorial sea is measured as generally the low water line. Where there is a break or passage in that reef, the baseline is a straight line joining the seaward entry points of that break or passage.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These Regulations consist of 25 sections concerning: interpretation (sect. 1); licences (sects. 2-4); fixed fishing gear (4a); register of fishing (sect. 5); identification marks (sect. 6); transfer of interest (sect. 7); production of licence (sect. 8); catch effort returns (sect. 9); maintenance of register of fishermen (sect. 10); use of fishing nets (sect. 11); general restrictions on taking fish (sect. 12); offences (sects. 13-17); grant of licence to use fishing lines (sect. 18); duty to return fish (sect. 19); use of explosives, substances (sect. 20); prohibition against introducing live or unfrozen and uncooked fish into waters of Bermuda (20a); hauling up nets and removing fish without consent of owner (sect. 21); offences against Regulations (sect. 22); inspection and enforcement (sect. 23).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Ordinance to provide for the protection, regulation and control of products of the sea in the waters of, and adjacent to, the Virgin Islands, and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Ordinance consists of 14 sections: Short title (sect. 1); Interpretation (sect. 2); Fisheries inspectors (sect. 3); Power to declare protected areas (sect. 4); Prohibited methods of fishing (sect. 5); Restriction on export (sect. 6); Foreign fishing boats (sect. 7); Enforcement power (sect. 8); Custody (sect. 9); Detention of vessels (sect. 10); Trial of offences (sect. 11); Rules (sect. 12); Penalty for possession (sect. 13); Exemptions (sect. 14).The Ordinance provides for definitions in section 2. Categories of officers regarded as fisheries inspectors for the purposes of this Ordinance are listed under section 3. The Minister may by Order declare any area of waters within the exclusive fishing zone, whether including or not any area of land up to the high water mark adjacent to such waters, to be a protected area (sect. 4). Under section 5, the Minister is authorized to prohibit by order, anywhere within the exclusive fishing zone, the taking of: a) any species or kind of marine product absolutely or

meta.name: geographicalArea_es

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These Rules consist of 15 sections and 2 Schedules: Short title (sect. 1); Definitions (sect. 2); Spiny lobster (sect. 3); Minimum size of lobster (sect. 4); Prohibited methods of fishing (sect. 5); Interference with fish traps (sect. 6); Licensing of fishing boats (sect. 7); Licence and fees (sect. 8); Registration of fishing boats (sect. 9); Duplicate licence (sect. 10); Markings on commercial fishing boats (sect. 11); Markings on pleasure fishing boats (sect. 12); Markings on big game sport fishing boats (sect. 13); Fishing without a licence is prohibited (sect. 14); Taking marine products without licence (sect. 15).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Order consists of 3 paragraphs and a Schedule. Citation (para. 1); Declaration of protected areas (para. 2); Prohibition of taking of marine products and anchoring of vessels in protected areas (para. 3); Schedule.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: National Assembly of Republic of Bulgaria, WWW, Bulgaria.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act consists 81 articles divided into 11 Chapters: General provisions (1); Internal waters (2); territorial sea (3); Contiguous zone (4); Continental shelf (5); Exclusive Economic Zone (6); Marine scientific research (7); Protection of and prohibition regarding pollution of the marine environment (8); Safety at sea (9); Right of hot pursuit (10); Administrative and penal provisions; Monetary penalties with respect to the scuttling or abandonment of vessels (11).In this Act establishing the maritime zones of the People's Republic of Bulgaria, provisions addressing specifically the issue of fishing are found under Chapter 6 on the Exclusive Economic Zone and under Chapter 11 on monetary penalties. Chapter 6, article 50, stipulates that no foreign ships may engage in commercial fishing in the Exclusive Economic Zone of Bulgaria, save in the case of an Agreement between the People's Republic of Bulgaria and the flag state. Article 76 of Chapter 11 provides for a fine of between 500 to 100 000 leva to be impo

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Decree No. 77 establishing an Exclusive Economic Zone of the People's Republic of Bulgaria in the Black Sea, 1987.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: National Assembly of Republic of Bulgaria, WWW, Bulgaria.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Decree is composed of 4 articles. It establishes an exclusive economic zone extending up to 200 nautical miles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret sur la proportion des indemnités pour dommages causés à l'économie halieutique.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Texte court comprenant 4 articles et des dispositions transitoires et finales.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret-loi nº 1/3 portant statut général de la coopération au Burundi et décret nº 100/20 portant le statut général de la coopérative au Burundi.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce décret-loi régit les organisations coopératives et les organismes à caractère coopératif. Il est formé par 108 articles répartis en 8 chapitres, à savoir: Dispositions générales, relatives à la personalité juridique, à l'objet, au siège des coopératives, à la formation des unions des coopératives et de la fédération nationale (I); Organisation et administration de la coopérative (II); Organisation financière, tutele et contrôle (III); Responsabilités et sanctions (IV); Fusion et scission des coopératives (V); Dissolution - Liquidation (VI); Dispositions particulières concernant les groupements à vocation coopérative, qui sont des structures précoopératives à caractère transitoire et évolutif, constitués en zones rurales ou urbaines dans le but de permettre la création de coopératives économiquement et socialment viables (VII); Dispositions transitoires et finales (VIII). Le décret nº 100/20 du 4 février 1981 porte le statut général de la coopérative au Burundi.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 82/0214/PRES/CMPRN/ET relatif à l'organisation et la réglementation de la pêche en Haute Volta.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte comprend 10 articles organisés en 3 parties. Définition - Catégories et redevances des permis de pêche - Dispositions relatives aux permis de pêche.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 740/107 relative à l'immatriculation des bateaux et embarcations.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Bulletin officiel du Burundi nº 7/78, p. 286 et 287.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Texte prévoyant des dispositions relatives à l'immatriculation des bateaux et embarcations. Cette ordonnance comprend 19 articles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Fisheries Management and Administration (Fiat-Law No. 33 KRO. CHOR).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This text consists of 44 articles divided into 6 Chapters: Interpretation (1); Exploitation in inland fishery domain, aquaculture and processing freshwater fishery product (2); Exploitation in marine fishery domain; Aquaculture and processing sea product (3); Competent authorities for solving the fishery law violation (4); Penalty (5); Final order (6).All kind of fishing in the fishery domain is subject to permission and may be allowed only for small scale - family - fishing and for middle scale fishing. Other provisions concern fishing gear that are prohibited in the inland fishery domain.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Sub-Law No. 66 OR.NOR.KROR. on transportation of fishery product.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This text consists of 15 articles regulating transportation of both marine and freshwater fishery products. Any person conducting such operation is required to hold a licence (art. 3). It then fixes conditions attached to the licence and sets out offences and fines.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Sub-Law No. 26 OR.NOR.KROR. on hiring inland and marine fishery domain for fishery exploitation.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Sub-law regulates the leasing of inland and marine fishery areas. Fishing lots, other than those reserved for the Ministry of Agriculture, shall be rented to private citizens for fishing on an auction basis. A public advertisement for this purpose shall be made at the Department of Fisheries and local agencies (art. 4). A person who wants to bid on a fishing right shall make a bid application at least 10 days before the auction in accordance with provisions of article 6. The fishing right auctioned shall be for 2 consecutive fishing seasons (art. 7). Article 8 outlines the procedure of auction. The bidder shall place a provisional bond and the "provisional renter" shall place a definitive bond (art. 9). The successful bidder may, after the definitive decision of the Ministry of Agriculture, sub-lease a part of the fishing lot of which the yield must not be higher than 50 percent of the whole lot (art. 17). The holders of the fishing rights have the power to arrest persons and seize goods on the fishing l

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation No. 0040.PROR.KOR.KOR.SOR.KOR. on demarcation of inland fishing lots and fish sanctuaries.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Proclamation to delimit inland fishing lots and fish sanctuary. It consists of 4 articles and a table on demarcation and location of fishing lots.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation No. 0002.PROR.KOR.KOR.SOR.KOR. on competent authorities in issuing permission to do fishery in open water, aquaculture, fish processing and special permissions.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Proclamation consists of 9 articles regulating the issuance of licences (fishing, aquaculture, processing and special authorization).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 81-13 portant régime des forêts, de la faune et de la pêche.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte comprend 140 articles organisés en 6 titres dont le titre 4 consacré à la pêche. Ce dernier comprend 7 chapitres (articles 78-113), à savoir: Des définitions (I); De l'exercice du droit de pêche (II); De la gestion et de la conservation des ressources halieutiques (III); De la mariculture et de la pisciculture (IV); De la mise en place des établissements de pêche (V); L'inspection sanitaire et le contrôle des produits de la pêche (VI); Le conditionnement et le transport des produits de pêche (VII).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Coastal Fisheries Protection Act (R.S.C. 1985, c. C-33).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to protect coastal fisheries.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This text consists of 19 sections divided into 7 Titles. Short title (1); Interpretation (2); Foreign fishing vessels (3); Regulations (4); Inspection, seizure and forfeiture (5); Offences and penalties (6); Jurisdiction of courts (7).The Act revolves around the basic prohibition on foreign fishing vessels and persons connected thereto to enter Canadian fisheries waters, as defined in the Act, to fish, unload, land or tranship any fish, outfit or supplies, to purchase or obtain bait, etc., to take or prepare marine plants unless authorized by this Act or the regulations, any other law of Canada or a treaty. The Act also prohibits the bringing into Canadian fisheries waters of fish received outside such waters from a foreign fishing vessel unless authorized by the regulations. Canadian fisheries waters are defined in section 2 as "all waters in the fishing zones of Canada, all waters in the territorial sea of Canada and all internal waters of Canada.".

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: Regulations respecting the protection of the coastal fisheries of Canada.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Consolidated Acts and Regulations of Canada.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This text consists of 20 sections and 3 Schedules, divided into the following headings: Short title; Interpretation; Authorization; Licences; Application for licence; Terms and conditions of licence; Permits; Authorized entry; Signals; Licence fees for foreign fishing vessels (Schedule 1); Landing permit fees (Schedule 2).Licences may be issued authorizing a foreign fishing vessel to engage in commercial fishing or fishing for scientific purposes, to tranship or take on board any fish, outfit or supplies while at sea, to process fish at sea, to transport fish from fishing grounds, to service other foreign fishing vessels while at sea, to purchase supplies at a Canadian port, to purchase, land or process fish or fish products at a Canadian port, etc. (sect. 5). Applications for licences are to be presented to the regional headquarters of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans responsible for issuing such licences for that flag state (sect. 6). Section 7 lists information to be supplied with applications. Secti

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Canadian Laws Offshore Application Act (S.C. 1990, c. C-18.5).

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to apply federal laws and provincial laws to offshore areas and to amend certain Acts in consequence thereof.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Consolidated Acts and Regulations of Canada.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Act to apply federal and provincial laws to offshore areas, divided into the following titles: Short title; Interpretation; Declaratory provisions; Application of federal laws; Application of provincial laws; Court jurisdiction; General provisions; Consequential and related amendments.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Agreement between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of Canada on East Coast Fishery Resources.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Agreement consists of 3 Chapters, 25 articles and 4 Annexes dealing with specific fisheries issues. Fishery management (Chapter I); Arbitration (Chapter II); Miscellaneous (Chapter III).An Agreement to provide for the conservation and management of East Coast fishery resources and for the terms and conditions under which all fishing by nationals and vessels of both Parties shall be conducted. A joint management commission, the East Coast Fisheries Commission, is established.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Protocol amending the Convention between the United States of America and Canada for the Preservation of the Halibut Fishery of the Northern Pacific Ocean and the Bering Sea, 1979.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Protocol to provide for the preservation of halibut in the Northern Pacific Ocean and Bering Sea. Article 1 prohibits the fishing of halibut, except as expressly provided in paragraphs 2 and 5 of the same article. Nationals and fishing vessels of, and fishing vessels licenced by the United States of America or Canada may fish for halibut in Convention waters only, in accordance with this Convention and as provided by the International Pacific Halibut Commission's Regulations. Sport fishing for halibut and other species by nationals and vessels of each Party may be conducted in Convention waters subject to licence and permit requirements and conditions. The Parties agree to continue the International Fisheries Commission established for the preservation of halibut in 1923.

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Proclamation No. 5 of 1977 on the contiguous zone.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Proclamation to establish a fisheries zone contiguous to the territorial sea of the Cayman Islands.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Cet arrêté comporte 11 articles. Il établit l'obligation de posséder un permis de pêche. Il distingue 2 catégories de permis: catégorie A réservée aux nationaux et catégorie B réservée aux étrangers.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Procedures for the collection and use of fishery resources propagation and protection fees.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Regulations to formulate procedures for the collection and use of fishery resources propagation and protection fees. Article 1 stipulates that all units and individuals who harvest aquatic animals or plants that grow naturally or are artificially cultured within waters under the jurisdiction of China shall pay fees. The text then deals with the collection system, the determination of the amount of fee, and the utilization of the collected fees.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Regulations to protect and rationally utilize fishery resources, regulate fishing intensity, maintain production order, safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of fishing operators and promote fishery development. A licence mechanism is devised identifying three types of licences: Fishing licence (including licences for fishing in coastal waters, high seas and inland waters); special fishing licence and; temporary fishing licence. Licensing authorities, procedures and conditions attached to each type of licence are then defined.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Regulations for the Implementation of the Fisheries Law of the People's Republic of China, 1987.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Government publication "Fisheries Law of the PR of China" 1990, pp. 55-75.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This text defines the administrative structure of the People's Republic of China regarding fisheries. The 42 articles are divided into seven Chapters: General Provisions (I); Fishery Superintendence (II); Aquaculture (III); Fishing (IV); Increase and Protection of Fishery Resources (V); Penalty (VI); Supplementary Provisions (VII).Article 3 stipulates that "State superintendence of fisheries shall operate under the principle of unified leadership and decentrealized administration". It addresses the issues of fishing authorization, enforcement, conservation measures, building of artificial reefs, and offences.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 76 038/CE précisant les limites territoriales comoriennes.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ordonnance fixant respectivement les limites des eaux territoriales comoriennes à 12 milles marins et celles de la zone économique exclusive à 200 milles marins.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 82-015 relative à l'activité des navires de pêche étrangers dans les zones maritimes comoriennes.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Loi qui porte réglementation de l'activité des navires de pêche étrangers dans les zones maritimes comoriennes. Ce texte comprend 22 articles organisés en 4 titres, à savoir: Conditions de l'activité des navires de pêche étrangers dans les zones maritimes comoriennes (I); Police des pêches (II); Infractions et poursuites (I); Dispositions générales (IV).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 79-019 interdisant la capture des tortues de mer dans les eaux territoriales des Comores, de même que dans les eaux internationales limitrophes.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Décret interdisant la capture des tortues de mer dans les eaux territoriales des Comores, de même que dans les eaux internationales limitrophes.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 015/88 règlementant la pêche maritime en République populaire du Congo.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: La présente loi constitue le nouveau texte de base en matière de droit des pêches. Elle abroge de ce fait les dispositions relatives à la pêche de la loi nº 30 63 du 4 juillet 1963 portant Code de la marine marchande. La loi concerne uniquement la pêche pratiquée dans les eaux marines sous juridiction congolaise (arts. 1 et 2). A ce titre elle distingue quatre types de pêche: la pêche industrielle, artisanale, scientifique et en amateur (art. 3). Le nouveau texte pose le principe que la gestion des ressources naturelles vivantes se trouvant dans les eaux sous juridiction congolaise est confiée aux autorités de la pêche maritime (art. 6). Ces autorités peuvent être selon les cas, le ministre chargé de la pêche maritime, tout fonctionnaire ou administration désigné par le ministre, les ambassadeurs et les consuls (art. 5). Le ministre se voit attribuer un pouvoir général de réglementation (arts. 7 et 8). La loi institue par ailleurs un Fonds d'aménagement halieutique destiné à financer les investissements néces

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 22-70 sur la mer territoriale, la pollution des eaux de la mer, l'exercice de la pêche maritime, l'exploitation des produits de la mer telle que modifiée par l'Ordonnance nº 49-77.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République populaire du Congo, 1er août 1970, p. 428 à 432.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte comprend 42 articles organisés en 8 titres, à savoir: Mer territoriale (I); Le domaine public maritime (II); Navires étrangers (III); Pas de Titre (IV); Hygiène et salubrité (V); Procedure (VI); Arraisonnement et retenue des navires étrangers (VII); Droit de transiger (VIII).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Exclusive Economic Zone (Foreign Fishing Craft) Regulations 1979.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These Regulations regulate fishing operations conducted by foreign fishing vessels within the economic exclusive zone of the Cook Islands. They consists of 45 sections: Administration (sects. 3-5); Licensing of foreign fishing craft (sects. 6-17); Control of licensed craft in the exclusive economic zone (sects. 18-36); Enforcement (sects. 37-41); Miscellaneous provisions (sects. 42-45) and one Schedule providing three types of forms: application for licence, licence to fish in the exclusive economic zone and bond to secure surrender of craft for forfeiture.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ministry of Marine Resources Act, 1984 (Act No. 15).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Section 3 stipulates that there shall be a Department of State to be known as the Ministry of Marine Resources. Principal objectives and functions of the Ministry are set out in section 4. The Secretary of Marine Resources shall be the administrative head of the Ministry (sect. 5). Both the Minister and the Secretary may delegate powers (sects. 9 and 10). Powers of the Minister are spelled out in section 11. The Minister may initiate special investigation (sect. 12). The Secretary shall furnish to the Minister a yearly report on the operations of the Ministry (sect. 14). Section 15 provides for the power to make regulations.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to provide for the management and development of fisheries.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Act to provide for the conservation and management of fishery in the fishery waters of the Cook Islands. "Fishery waters" comprises the territorial sea, the EEZ and internal waters, including lagoons, as defined in the Territorial Sea and Exclusive Economic Zone Act, 1977.The Act consists of 62 sections divided into 5 Parts: Fisheries management and development (I); Foreign fishing (II); Powers of authorized officers and observers (III); Sale, release and forfeiture of retained property (IV); Jurisdiction and evidence (V).For purposes of conservation and development of fish resources, the Minister may authorize a fishery as designated fishery under section 3. A fisheries plan shall be prepared and kept under review for each designated fishery. Local fisheries committees may be established by the Secretary of Marine Resources on islands under section 4. Island Councils shall have the power to promulgate by-laws for fishing in the designated fishery of the Island (sect. 5). They shall also have the power to

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to amend the Marine Resources Act 1989.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act shall be read together with and be deemed part of the Marine Resources Act 1989. It consists of an adjustment of the amount of the minimum fine that may be imposed on foreign fishing vessel having violated provisions of the Act.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to amend the Marine Resources Act 1989.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act shall be read together with and deemed part of the Marine Resources Act. It consists of 11 sections amending sections of the 1989 Act which deal with: access agreement; drifnet fishing activities; cancellation or suspension of fishing licences; prohibited fishing methods; powers of authorized officers between limits of fishery waters; removal of parts from seized vessels; courts power of forfeiture; removal of item in custody; jurisdiction of the High Court; observer devices.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These By-Laws consist of 18 sections divided into 5 Parts: Shellfish (I); Spearfishing (II); Net fishing (III); Miscellaneous (IV); Penalty (V). The text is completed by a Schedule.They apply to the islands of Aitutaki, Manuae and Te-Au-O-Tonga and extend to the waters surrounding the islands seaward up to the 200 nautical mile limit.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Manihiki Pearl and Pearl Shell By-Laws 1991.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: These By-laws consist of 19 sections divided into 6 Parts: Free diving (I); Pearl farming (II); Culture pearl farming permit (III); Technicians (IV); Enforcement (V); Penalties (VI).They apply to the Island of Manihiki.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Breadth of the Territorial Waters Law (No. 45/64).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Law to provide for the delimitation of the territorial waters of the Republic. In this Law, unless the context otherwise requires, "territorial waters" means that part of the sea adjacent to the coast of the Republic which is deemed to be part of its territory and is subject to the sovereignty of the Republic. The extent of territorial waters shall be the zone within a radius of twelve (12) nautical miles of the coast of the Republic, measured from low water mark.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: A Law to make provision for the exploration and exploitation of the continental shelf of the Republic and for matters connected therewith.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Law provides for the exploration and exploitation of the continental shelf of the Republic of Cyprus. The Law defines the continental shelf as the seabed and subsoil of the submarine areas adjacent to the coast of the Republic, but beyond the territorial waters, where the depth of the superjacent waters admits of the exploitation of the natural resources of the said areas; provided that, in relation to any State whose coasts lie opposite those of the Republic, the outer boundary of the continental shelf shall, unless otherwise agreed between the Republic and that State, in no case extend beyond the median line. "Territorial waters" in this Law, means the zone delimited by section two (2) of the Territorial waters Law (No. 45/64). The Law provides for the application of Laws to the continental shelf, contains provisions on the prohibition to interfere with the exploitation of the continental shelf, and establishes penalties to persons acting in contravention of the provisions of this Law.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Ordinance to consolidate and regulate fishing in the waters of the sovereign base areas.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: The Sovereign Base Areas Gazette No. 614, Supplement II, 6 April 1982, pp. 3-8.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Ordinance to consolidate and regulate fishing in the waters of the Sovereign Base Areas. It regulates matters concerning fishing licences (no vessel to be used for fishing without a licence), issue and expiration of licence, use of explosives or poisons, issue of Regulations for the better carrying ot of the purposes of this Ordinance, powers to police officers or customs officers, forfeiture and cancellation of licence, compounding offences.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: The Sovereign Base Areas Gazette No. 927, 7 March 1991, pp. 13 and 14.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Ordinance shall be read as one with the Fisheries (Consolidation) Ordinance, 1982. Sections 3,5 and 6 of the 1982 Ordinance are hereby amended (amendments concern penalties against trespassers).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Law No. 597 on the Fishing Territory of the Kingdom of Denmark.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Law to extend the fishing territory of the Kingdom of Denmark. The Prime Minister shall be empowered to enact that the fishing territory of the Kingdom of Denmark be extended to a breadth of 200 nautical miles (1 nautical mile = 1,852 metres) so that the fishing territory, in addition to the internal waters, shall comprise waters along the coasts of the Kingdom of Denmark, delimited by a line (the fishing limit) which at every point is 200 nautical miles from the baselines applicable at any given time. The extension may be effected for one area at a time.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Order No. 598 on the Fishing Territory of the Faeroe Islands.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Order provides for the extension of the fishery territory seaward up to 200 nautical miles.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Notice No. 629 on the fishing territory of Greenland.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This notice establishes the fishery territory of Greenland.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Royal Decree of 21 December 1966 on delimitation of the territorial sea (No. 19).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Decree to delineate the territorial sea of Denmark.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Act is composed of 5 chapters, i.e.: Scope and Object of this Act (I); Regulation of Fishery Activities (II); Regulations Governing Catch Capacity (III); Administration and Inspection (IV); Penalties; Entry into Force (V). This Act shall not apply to Greenland or the Faeroe Islands.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi 52/AN/79 concernant la mer territoriale, la zone contigüe, la zone économique exclusive, les frontières maritimes et l'exercice de la pêche.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Cette loi est relative à la délimitation des eaux territoriales, à la zone contigüe, à la zone économique exclusive, aux frontières maritimes et à l'exercice de la pêche.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté nº 85-0040/PR/PM fixant les limites des différentes zones de navigation commerciale et de pêche maritime.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte prévoit l'organisation de la navigation commerciale. Cette dernière est divisée en long cours, cabotage international, cabotage national, navigation côtière et navigation de pilotage. L'organisation de la navigation de pêche est renvoyée à un arrêté ultérieur.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 85-048 PR/PM portant définition des limites et des frontières maritimes.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte fixe les limites des eaux territoriales.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 154/AN/85 portant organisation du Ministère de l'agriculture et du développement rural.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République de Djibouti , 30 Juin 1985, p. 87 à 90.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Cette loi porte organisation de l'administration du Ministère de l'agriculture et du développement rural. Le Ministère comprend un secrétariat général et les services suivants, compétents en fonction de leurs domaines d'intervention: agriculture et forêts; élevage et pêches; génie rural et laboratoire d'analyses et de recherches.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté nº 85-1598/PR/PM portant organisation de la pêche non professionnelle.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République de Djibouti, 16 janvier 1986, p. 9 et 10.(photocopie, 5 p.).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte est composé de 12 articles répartis en 5 sections: Champ d'application (I); Délivrance et validité du permis (II): Engins de pêche - interdictions des procédés de pêche (III); Quota du produit de pêche (IV).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 83-021/PR/S.A.M. portant refonte de la Commission de sauvegarde de la faune et des fonds sous-marins.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République de Djibouti nº 2, 31 mars 1983, p. 587.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte porte création de la Commission de sauvegarde de la faune et des fonds sous-marins. Cette commission a pour mission l'étude des problèmes de protection et d'enrichissement de la faune et des fonds sous-marins.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 87-052/PR/PM portant création du Conseil national de la mer.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République de Djibouti nº 80, 15 septembre 1987, p. 8 et 9.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Décret portant création du Conseil national de la mer chargé de définir les actions gouvernementales dans tous les domaines de l'activité maritime. Il définit la composition (art. 2), les fonctions (art. 3) et établit le bilan annuel de l'ensemble des activités du secteur.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 212/AN/82 portant Code des affaires maritimes.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République de Djibouti, 15 mars 1982, p. 391 à 405.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte comprend 227 articles répartis en 7 titres, à savoir: Généralités (I); La navigation maritime et le domaine public maritime (II); Statut du navire (III); Statut du marin (IV); Les activités maritimes (V); Le régime disciplinaire et pénal (VI); Dispositions transitoires (VII).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 85-006/PR/PM fixant les marques d'identité des navires.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Texte fixant les normes d'identification des navires.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Arrêté nº 92-0631/PR/MADR portant création d'un Comité interministeriel de suivi et de supervision du projet de développement integré de la pêche.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Arrêté portant création d'un Comité interministériel de suivi et de supervision du projet de développement integré de la pêche.

meta.name: geographicalArea_fr
meta.content: Mer Rouge et le golfe d'Aden

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Accord de coopération technique dans le domaine de la pêche entre le Gouvernement de la République de Djibouti et le Gouvernement Démocratique de Somalie.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Accord bilatéral entre la République de Djibouti et la République Démocratique de Somalie. Cet Accord reconnait les droits historiques des pêcheurs djiboutiens dans les eaux territoriales somaliennes. En contrepartie, le Gouvernement djiboutien accorde aux pêcheurs somaliens l'accès de leurs produits au marché djiboutien ainsi que des facilités techniques (art. 1). L'Accord est valable pour une durée de 5 ans renouvelable automatiquement pour des périodes analogues à moins d'une notification écrite de dénonciation ou d'amendement faite par l'une des parties au moins 3 mois avant expiration (art. 5).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Ordonnance nº 74-1 fixant le régime foncier, modifiée par la loi nº 19 du 26 novembre 1983 relative aux compétences des juridictions judiciaires et des commissions consultatives.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Cette ordonnance porte régime foncier. Elle comprend 22 articles répartis en 4 titres. Le titre I - Dispositions générales - définit l'Etat comme gardien de toutes les terres et comme garant des droits dérivant de la propriété. Les interventions de l'Etat pour assurer un usage rationnel des terres ou pour tenir compte des impératifs de la défence ou des options économiques seront fixés par décret. Le titre II porte régime de la propriété privée. Il indique quelles sont les terres formant objet du droit de propriété et les delais dans lesquels les titulaires de livrets fonciers, "certificates of occupancy" et de jugements définitifs doivent les faire transformer en titres fonciers. Il indique aussi les conditions formelles essentielles des actes transalatifs, constitutifs et extinctifs. Les personnes étrangères peuvent conclure des baux ou acquérir des propriétés immobilières, sauf dans les zones frontalières, et les ressources du sous-sol n'entrent pas dans ces aquisistions (les dispositions relatives à l'acq

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Council Regulation (EEC) No. 3760/92 establishing a Community system for fisheries and aquaculture.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Official Journal of the European Communities L 389, Vol. 35, 31 December 1992, pp. 1-13.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Regulation establishes a Community system for the management of exploitation activities that must enable a balance to be achieved between resources and exploitation in the various fishing areas. In order to ensure sustainable development, it also establishes a framework for the regulation of access, management and monitoring of exploitation activities, as well as the requisite means and procedures. It consists of 21 articles divided into 3 Titles: Rules of access to waters and resources (I); Management and monitoring of fishing activity (II); General provisions (III).

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Convention on Future Multilateral Cooperation in the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Convention establishes an international organization, known as the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization (NAFO), whose object is to contribute through consultation and cooperation to the optimum utilization, rational management and conservation of the fishery resources of the Convention Area.

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Ordinance provides for the regulation, conservation and management of the fisheries of the Falkland Islands. It consists of 21 sections that deal with fishing prohibited without a licence (sec.4), notification of fish on board by fishing boats entering fishing waters (sec.5), transhipment and export of fish prohibited without a licence (sec.7), Manner of exercising of licensing powers (sec.8), Director of Fisheries and Fisheries Protection Officers (sec.9), Release of boat or thing if no proceedings instituted (sec.11), Security for release of fishing boat (sec.12), Offences, penalties and proceedings (sec.15) etc.

meta.name: geographicalArea_en
meta.content: LATIN AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN FAO

meta.name: geographicalArea_es
meta.content: AMERICA LATINA Y EL CARIBE FAO

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A proclamation to assert Falkland Islands sovereignty over the seabed and subsoil of the continental shelf, including the natural resources thereof.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Marine Spaces (Archipelagic Baselines and Exclusive Economic Zone) Order, 1981 (Chap. 158 A, Secs. 4, 6).

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Regional Compendium of Fisheries Legislation (Western Pacific Region), FAO, June 1993, pp. 559-564.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: This Order identifies the points between which straight baselines are to be drawn in order to determine the outermost limits of the exclusive economic zone and of the archipelagic waters of Fiji and the innermost limits of the territorial sea of the Fiji archipelago.

meta.name: longTitleOfText
meta.content: An Act to make provision for the regulation of fishing.

meta.name: publicationReference
meta.content: Regional Compendium of Fisheries Legislation (Western PAcific Region), FAO, June 1993, pp. 589-613.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: An Act to make provision for the regulation of fishing in the fisheries waters of Fiji.The text consists of 20 sections: Short title (1); Interpretation (2); Appointment of fish wardens (3); Application of Act to the exclusive economic zone (4); Licence to take fish (5); Registration (6); Power of examination and detention (7); Cancellation of licence to take fish (8); Regulations (9); Offences (10); Power to permit use of explosives (11); Rewards (12); Protection of native customary rights (13); Native fisheries commission (14); Inquiry (15); Announcement of decision (16); Appeal (17); Power to summon witnesses (18); Registration (19); Copy of register (20).Terms "exclusive economic zone", "fish", "fishing" and "foreign fishing vessel" shall have the meaning assigned to them by subsection (1) of section 2 of the Marine Spaces Act. A licensing Officer may, at discretion, grant fishing licences. However, subject to subsection (2) of section 12 of the Marine Spaces Act, no foreign fishing licence shall be grant

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Law concerning the continental shelf (No. 149 of 1965).

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: A Law on the Continental Shelf of Finland. The "Continental Shelf" means the area outside of the territorial sea of Finland with the seabed and subsoil adjacent to the boundary line which is determined in accordance with articles 1 and 6 of the Geneva Convention of 1958. Article 2 provides for the granting of rights of exploitation by Finnish citizens or foreigners. Natural resources for the purposes of this law are defined as minerals and other non-living resources of the seabed and subsoil together with sedentary living organisms which are immobile on or under the seabed or are unable to move except in constant physical contact with the seabed or the subsoil thereof. The remaining provisions deal with exploitation and breach of the Law. (8 articles)

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº. 84-512 relative à la pêche en eau douce et à la gestion des ressources piscicoles.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française, 30 juin 1984, p. 2039 à 2045.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte prévoit des dispositions règlementant l'exercice de la pêche en eau douce ainsi que des dispositions relatives à la gestion piscicole en eau douce. Il comprend 12 articles répartis en 6 chapitres, à savoir: Champ d'application (I); De la préservation des milieux aquatiques et de la protection du patrimoine piscicole (II); De l'organisation des pêcheurs (III); Du droit de pêche, de son exercice et de la gestion des ressources piscicoles (IV); De la police de la pêche (V); Dispositions diverses (VI).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 87-719 pris pour l'application de l'article 419 du Code rural et fixant les conditions d'exploitation du droit de pêche de l'Etat.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française, 2 septembre 1987, p. 10091 à 10094.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce texte fixe les conditions d'exploitation du droit de pêche de l'Etat. Les eaux, sur lesquelles le droit de pêche appartient à l'Etat, sont divisées en lots. Ces derniers font l'objet de location en vue de leur exploitation au profit d'associations agréées de pêche ou de pisciculture. Le texte distingue deux catégories de droit de pêche en fonction des engins utilisés: le droit de pêche aux lignes et le droit de pêche aux engins et aux filets. Le texte comprend 4 sections: Conditions générales d'exploitation (I); Modalités de location des lots (II); Procédure d'adjudication publique (III); Dispositions diverses (IV).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 85-1284 relatif à la pêche en eau douce pratiquée par des amateurs.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 283, 6 décembre 1985, p. 14182 et 14183.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce décret distingue deux categories de pêcheurs amateurs en fonction des engins utilisés: les pêcheurs amateurs aux engins et aux filets et les autres pêcheurs amateurs. Les premiers exercant sur les eaux du domaine public doivent adhérer à l'association agréée de pêcheurs amateurs aux engins et aux filets sur les eaux du domaine public du département dans lequel ils pratiquent cette pêche. Les seconds doivent adhérer à une association agréée de pêche et de pisciculture.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret nº 90-94 pris pour l'application de l'article 3 du décret du 9 janvier 1852 modifié fixant les conditions générales d'exercice de la pêche maritime dans les eaux soumises à la réglementation communautaire de conservation et de gestion.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Ce décret définit les conditions générales d'exercice de la pêche maritime dans les eaux soumises à la réglementation communautaire de conservation et de gestion. Il comprend huit titres, à savoir: Dispositions administratives (I); Autorisation de certains types ou procédés de pêche et limitation du nombre de leurs bénéficiaires (II); Limitation du volume des captures (III); Prohibitions diverses (IV); Dispositions particulières (V); Mesures d'ordre et de précaution (VI); Dispositions pénales (VII); Abrogations (VIII).

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 85-542 modifiant le décret du 9 janvier 1852 sur l'exercice de la pêche maritime.

meta.name: serialImprint
meta.content: Journal officiel de la République française nº 119, 24 mai 1985, p. 5815 à 5817.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: La présente loi dispose qu'en règle générale la pêche maritime s'exerce conformement aux règlements de la Communauté économique europeenne. Cependant, lorsque la mise en application effective de ces règlements l'exige ou le permet ou lorsque la pêche s'exerce dans les eaux ou par des activités ne relevant pas du champ d'application de ces règlements, des décrets en conseil d'Etat fixent les conditions d'exercice de la pêche maritime.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Loi nº 91-627 portant diverses dispositions en matière de pêche maritime et de cultures marines.

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: La présente loi prévoit diverses dispositions en matière de pêches maritimes et de cultures marines.

meta.name: titleOfText
meta.content: Décret du 9 janvier 1852 sur l'exercice de la pêche maritime (texte tel que modifié jusqu'en 1983)

meta.name: textAbstract
meta.content: Le present décret règle l'exercice de la pêche maritime. Il prévoit des dispositions relatives à la capture des animaux et la récolte des vegetaux marins, en mer et dans la partie des fleuves, rivières, étangs et canaux où les eaux sont salées.
